Everything was delicious and perfectly executed but of course we were there for the chicken. Which was incredible, juicy, delicious and the bread salad that comes with it is perfection. 
I can't rave/recommend enough. If you haven't been, go!
author: Victoria T.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in the city.  It's been there for 38yr.  I have never had a bad meal.  The Bloody Mary with Balsamic vinegar  is delish.  They are know for their Caesar salad and the roasted chicken.
author: Joyce C.

description: Not a bad place to have lunch if you are in the city for business; Since it is pretty much near the heart of most businesses in the city. But for the price, it's not impressive. Over the years, it has become run of the mill to me. Nothing in enticing. You want to meet over a business lunch, not over think where or what you are going to eat, good place. Beyond that, I would take a note to find something more noteworthy in the area.
author: Sonia A.

description:
Growing up in the area I remember Zuni as the place my parents would go to for a nice dinner with friends. While most of the restaurants they recommend from "back in the day" are not places I'd go out of my way for, Zuni was such a nice surprise. They've done a great job staying relevant amidst a surge of new hip restaurants. 
It's all about the chicken really. Every table around us had it so that's what we ordered too. The flavor was awesome and the skin was super crispy. I love that it came over a warm bread salad! It says it serves 2 but it could easily serve 3 or 4 if you got a side or too. There were only two of us and we had leftovers. 
The only negative I have to share is our waitress who was dismissive and a little rude. My friend and I were two of the younger diners at least on the floor we were on so we wondered if maybe she didn't like us because she prefers serving a different class of people. She didn't make eye contact with us, would disappear for long periods of time, and totally unfriendly. 

Other than that it was a great experience and I'm looking forward to going back!
author: Sophie S.

description:
Our meal here was probably more of a 3.5, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt since we didn't have the famous chicken.  The two of us walked in at just before six on a Friday evening and were immediately seated without a reservation.  We started with some Tomales Bay oysters, which were very good.  Then, I got the pork chop while she got the squab.  The pork chop was fine - pretty flavorful with a nice sear on the outside and not dry on the inside.  But it wasn't on the same level as the one at Nopa.  I tasted my girlfriend's squab, which was perfectly cooked and packed with flavor.  But it took some serious knife and fork gymnastics to get all the delicious meat off the bone, as expected.

As for the chicken... My cousin and his wife had previously invited us over for dinner and cooked the Zuni chicken from the restaurant's cookbook, and it was absolutely incredible.  That's why we tried something different at the actual restaurant.  Given what we know now, we'll definitely be getting the chicken next time, which is both delicious and a better deal, since it's a two person portion.
author: Simon L.

description: We love Zuni! Everything on the menu is full of layered flavors. Our recent lunch included the most delicious potato leek soup with capers and it was absolutely wonderful. The roasted chicken and bread salad, the burger, the steak, and the polenta are particular favorites. We always get the shoestring fries, no matter what. Getting there early and eating in the bar is lots of fun. This is truly one of the top restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Susan D.

description:
The food was absolutely delicious. We were in sf for 5 nights. This restaurant was on our list to try. 
I wish they can cook faster. We had reservation at 8.30. We showed up on time but we didnt get the table till 9. 
The food was so slow. We got out of the restaurant almost midnight. 
The portion of the food is so small if you compare to the price. 
Recommence Caesar salad. Love it. Simple but rare.
author: Mark T.

description: The food was really delicious, I would definitely eat here again. Even the inside was really cute and had a great atmosphere. It was nice and somewhat fancy, but not overly ritzy - it was still a very relaxing and calming environment. However, I thought portions were a bit small and the food took a little longer than expected to come out so I wouldn't come here super hungry. The portions is the only reason why I would give 4 stars instead of 5.
author: Bryce B.

description:
One of THE best brunch spots in San Francisco.  This place is more of a lunch spot, so you won't find any bacon or eggs on the menu, and that's just fine with me.

But you will find fresh oysters and amazing food. 

We came for the infamous roasted chicken.  It is made to order, so the wait time can be about 45 minutes.  When you're in good company and good food, the time passes by fairly quickly.  While we waited for the roasted chicken (which can really feed four people), we ordered the Cesar Salad - another Zuni staple.  The leaves are served whole and drizzled with a light Cesar dressing.  Probably one of the best I've ever had!  We also ordered a plate of orechetti with brussels sprouts for the table. 

And then the moment of truth!

Our roasted chicken finally arrived and it was worth the wait.  The skin was crispy and the meat juicy and everything was seasoned perfectly.  I don't know how they do it.  I've tried roasting a chicken at home and it's a lot of work, and the cooking is never consistent.  

Go, go, go for the chicken!
author: Hieu H.

description:
I'm ooooold school Zuni - Billy, Vince and Judy days.

My most recent visit was not the Zuni I've loved for 30+ years. And just to keep this review short, WHO THE F&CK GAVE THE THUMBS UP ON CHANGING THE ROAST CHICKEN WITH BREAD/SALAD STUFFING RECIPE?! 

No currants, no pine nuts, 2 pieces of soggy, un-toasted bread, and the vinegary-sweet tang on the dressing - gone.  Allllll gone. 

I realize change is inevitable. But if it ain't broke, don't fix it.
author: John D.

description: Everyone should go to Zuni! Locals, take your visitors! I can see why this place had lasted so many years. Beautiful, homey yet stylish decor, super friendly,  awesome staff...and then there's the food!  We were too hungry to wait for the famous chicken but the steak and fish were amazing. We COULD NOT stop eating the fries! The gateau victoire  (aka chocolate cake) was light and rich at the same time. The Panna cotta was another delicious ending. Just go...you won't be disappointed.
author: Teri K.

description: So beyond tasty! This is by far the best restaurant I've been to in a long time! Keep up the great work :) so so good
author: Chelsey E.

description: Great atmosphere. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The chicken for 2 was stellar. I especially liked the crusty bread that the chicken was served on. Delicious. Pasta dishes were well done - specially the gnocchi. The crispy artichoke appetizer was exceptional. Only downside was that the portions were rather small.
author: Patrick A.

description: The restaurant was amazing, the staff were friendly and professional, and the food was good. Even the salad was good and I don't usually like salads. Great job!
author: Alexander P.

description:
O.M.G. Why did it take me so long to try this place?!

Called in to see if they'd take a reservation on a Saturday night - they said they were booked, but they accepted walk-ins. We were able to walk in and get seated promptly at around 7:30pm... we weren't seated at a regular table and had to hail our server over a few times in the beginning, but service overall was pretty decent and food was just excellent.

Was the famous roast chicken worth the 1 hour wait? YES (x3). We munched on sides of fries and bread with sauerkraut and we still had room for the chicken. Also, not a beer drinker but I thought their menu selections paired quite nicely with our meal.

Next time I'll be coming in with a proper reservation and to try some of their other appetizers. Cute setting - I almost felt like I was back in NYC. It was intimate enough, yet bustling at the same time. Totally coming back!
author: Diana K.

description:
Zuni Cafe did not disappoint! After reading several reviews, my husband and I decided to head to Zuni for lunch and try the chicken. We were lucky to snag a lunch reservation within 15 minutes of us being in the area. The restaurant is really cute and I like the art on the walls. The tables are close together but that didn't bother me at all. 

We sat down and instantly told our server we wanted to order the roasted chicken for two since the menu states it takes about an hour. We looked over the menu and decided to split the black bean soup while we waited. The soup has a velvety texture and the pico de gallo added a nice texture change and bit of freshness to the plate. 

About 50 minutes after we ordered, a plate of roasted chicken arrived. The smell was amazing. We both dug in and agreed this is definitely the best roast chicken we have had. The chicken is served over a bread salad which is equally note worthy and a star on its own. The chicken had perfect texture (crispy skin) and everything was juicy and delicious. Worth the wait and the $50!!
author: Megan P.

description:
Went there with three other girls on a Wednesday night. Overall, the food did not impress us, the portion size to price ratio was frustrating. We left a little hungry. We were seated in the top level in the back of the restaurant which feels kind of like an attic. It was particularly hot that night, we were all sweating. This is not Zuni's fault perse, however, it definitely diminished our dining experience. I heard the brunch and lunch are great. I was really hoping to like this restaurant more.

Things I liked:
-This is a beautiful restaurant overall with a rustic elegant ambiance. 
-The service was excellent 
-Endive salad was very tasty with crumbly sharp cheese
-Great wine selection

Things that were disappointing:
-The sea bass, not very flavorful, the sides (fav beans) were small and overcooked 
-Burrata- lackluster
-Nothing I ate the whole night blew me away
author: E R.

description:
If you are looking for a bad service experience, this is your spot.  The hostesses and waiters are rude and so unaccommodating.  The manager is most rude, so no doubt he is training the staff!  Will never come back.  
To complete the experience, the completely unprofessional manager followed us to the street after hearing about the yelp review, started yelling we are never allowed back to the restaurant, started to frantically take pictures of us with his phone and threatened to call911 if we shows up at the restaurant!!!  It's more like Luni cafe!!
author: Malekeh A.

description:
I've come here on several separate occasions and enjoyed every visit. 

First visit: I happened to visit on the anniversary of the restaurant's opening. Oysters were super fresh (and the Olympia oyster was bursting with flavor despite its diminutive size). They served a special menu that my waiter was brimming with excitement about. I had a pasta and the world famous chicken, which was unforgettable and has singularly cemented my patronage for years to come. The staff also noticed that I didn't touch my pasta initially (due to an allergy), and graciously and instantly replaced it with a version that I could eat.

Second visit: Came here for a special occasion. The service was aware enough to realize when to bother me and my friends at the table and when to leave us alone. After ordering about half the wine by the glass list, we devoured enough of the chicken to leave us happy and drunk for the evening.

Third visit: Lunch outside with champagne, oysters, and friends. I never felt as if the service let us linger outside unattended for very long and the oysters were very fresh. The bill for a dozen oysters and a glass of wine came out to around $75, which was more than I wanted to spend for lunch, but hey, it's oysters we're talking about.

Overall, the wine is great, the oysters are great, the chicken is great, and the service is smart, elegant, and alert. Consistency, elegance, and great food and service is what makes Zuni Cafe a place to keep in our list of favorite SF restaurants for some future time.
author: Lawrence H.

description: My wife and I ate here tonight for my birthday.  I can't say enough about Zuni.  First, Christopher waited on us and he was amazing.  He was very personable, and was always a step ahead of us.  He helped us navigate the menu (drink and food) and was a delight to talk with.  I would definitely request his section next time we return.  Moving on to the food, we had oysters to start, the BEST Caesar salad I've ever had, and wonderful pasta, steak, and drinks.  Our table was visited by Rob, checking on us to make sure we were having a good time, which we were.  I couldn't imagine a better night celebrating my birthday.  Zuni is a San Francisco institution!
author: chris a.

description:
Lunch selection is disappointing for vegetarians. Salad or a choice of two pizzas were our only two options. I'd heard enough about the gnocchi to make my mouth water, but alas, not available at lunch.

We started with cocktails, and everyone seemed to really like theirs. All I remember about mine, other than enjoying it, was that it was slightly pink and had ginger beer. So...order that one if you can figure it out.

The other veg and I both ordered the Wagon Wheel pizza. The sorrel was a nice touch, but the overwhelming reaction was, "Meh." Wagon Wheel is great, but it's too mild to stand on its own, and also rather dry. The pizza would be improved, in my opinion, with some kind of sauce for flavor and texture - tomato, garlic butter, just something.

Alright, fine, I'll talk about the stupid chicken. Everyone said I had to try it, but for the whole meal there was an exposed, creepy-looking bone sticking out of the piece in front of me. I just couldn't do it. However - I cast aside my inner hippie long enough to taste the bread salad, and holy shit was that stuff amazing. BTW, they ordered 3 chickens to split between 5 people, and took home at least 1 and a half of the orders. It's a ridiculous amount of food.

Dessert was the highlight for me - we all split the gateau victoire (flourless chocolate cake), apple granita, and this other thing with meringue wafers and mandarin oranges (I don't know wtf it was, so just look at my picture). The chocolate cake was fabulous - super rich and velvety. The apple granita was gross, but I just hate granitas - who pays that much for a glorified slushie? Finally, that citrus-wafer-tower thing was divine. Interesting flavors and textures, not too sweet but still satisfying.

I might come back for drinks and dessert, but was really unimpressed with the food. It's a little too pricey to go back if I don't love it.
author: Rachel M.

description: Nice lunch spot in hayes valley. Service is a little bit slow so be prepared if u only have one hour lunch. Wide variety of selection for lunch menu. I had Alaska hallibut, wild mushroom pasta and a cheese pizza. Everything is perfectly cooked and tasted decent. Shoestring potatoes is a must try item in my opinion.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Everything besides the famous roast chicken was very average. Small portions of mediocre food. This is just a fancy pants place charging crazy prices.
The roast chicken is very good, but it is $50 and takes an hour. Chicken is like $8 at the store and this dish is literally roast chicken and a mixed green salad on top of bread.
Crepe dessert was bland, along with my husband's clam pasta and my soup. My salad was ok, but small for $10 and there wasn't a whole lot to it.
author: Vicky S.

description:
Fantastic location and I was overdue to try this place. Pull up on a rainy night and the place is bustling at 6:30pm. Grab a spot at the bar and take in the vibe: piano player and full mix of tech crowd, families, visitors all in a good mood to get some quality dinner. 

We had a table on the upper level facing Market St. and it was a great view. Wait service was good and attentive the whole time. Food was the star: Caesar Salad probably the best I have ever had. Lentil soup was flavorful. The real star was the roast chicken -OMG this was Amazing! You must get this at Zuni....tender, juicy, and seasoned perfectly, skin was delicious, and the bread pudding + salad it comes with were both great sides.

Overall recommend this spot for date night or family dinner and you won't be disappointed!
author: John F.

description: The best Caesar salad I have every had and the pizza was equally amazing!! Service was superb and the environment was bright, open and very inviting!! So grateful to have had this experience and I will, without a doubt, be back!
author: Cheryl D.

description: Went here to celebrate a friend's birthday for lunch. Service was great and the food exceptional. I ordered the rabbit which was just right although could not tell the difference between it and the chicken (no joke intended) . Will come back again but will order the lamn, more flavor. One other thing I did like is that they serve Acme bread.
author: Jerry M.

description:
Firstly - I've spent lots of time here - one of my old time faves - but not anymore !!

I really had one of the worst experiences here - I cruised in on a HOT day, around 3:30 - 4:00pm.  I told the host I just wanted oysters and lemonade, I wouldn't be long.  The host walked me to some tables and extended his arm, so I took the large table.  I had some extra bags, plus hot from travel and the 95 degree weather.  It was Obviously clearing out with people - no line anywhere.  Then he comes back over, and tells me to move to the small table.  (and by small - I mean s-m-a-l-l !)  I got up with my bags and trudged over to my new small table. There was no line anywhere - moving me was useless to say the least.  I was served oysters first, and my lemonade just sat at the bar - I got up, and grabbed it myself.

 I waved down a waiter, and complained that I was asked to move, when the place was obviously empty- I was having a super small meal, and wasn't taking up much time at all! That waiter had the nerve to argue with me ??  what ???  He proceeded to go on and on about - "..what if a 4 top walks in .. blah blah blah.."  I told him I didn't want to argue about this anymore - can you believe that ?

I've worked in fine dining AND hospitality - the drink comes FirsT you losers!!  And sometimes it's just nice to be nice!
author: Janet J.

description: The chicked is pretty good, but the service was not.  The waiter was very inattentive.  We accidentally spilled a glass of wine (we weren't at all drunk) and he never even asked if we wanted another one.  In fact he just ignored us and we had to track him down to get the check.
author: James N.

description:
I was lucky enough to try this restaurant last weekend.  Like you I read a couple of reviews to see what to order.  They have several excellent dishes but the main one is the oven cooked chicken, something I would not normally order.  So why did I? well, you have to wait 75 minutes while they cook it, who has time, it's just chicken.  My advice MAKE THE TIME.  It was simply the best chicken I ever had, moist, firm and delicious.
They also have excellent deserts, particularly ricotta ice cream, sounds weird, taste delicious. The cocktails were very good and I would listen to the recommendations, the staff were excellent
author: Lorcan M.

description: I had a great time here with some friends. Enjoyed a nice cold beer accompanied wit two large chickens fries and a cesar salad .
author: Jason M.

description:
The service here is stunning. I recommend asking for a seat at the top of the stairs so you have a nice view of the bar and the front of the restaurant. If you like watching your food being prepared, you may be able to ask for a seat facing the kitchen.

The chicken is great. It's steeply priced at $54 but it is fire roasted in-house and the salad that comes along with it is doused in the roasted chicken drippings and makes a far more splendid (and rich) salad than their famous Caesar Salad. 

Make sure that as soon as you get seated, you waste no time in ordering the chicken as it will take at least an hour for it to arrive.
author: Ze Lin X.

description:
Called to make reservations for a Friday evening two weeks prior with no problem. It was super busy but our server was attentive and provided us with a great experience. At the beginning of dinner, we asked to move closer to the window/Market street and the staff was great about it! 

Ordered a bottle of red wine (extensive wine list if you're into it), the gnocchi (good but wouldn't order again), Caesar salad (great), shoestring fries (was great but wished we had a dip to go alongside it, also HUGE portions) and ended the meal with two desserts and some coffee. Overall, came out to about $150 with tip for two people. Great meal and would come back again to try other things on the menu.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I love this place! It is so rustic and romantic, with a fun, young crowd! The service is great and super friendly!

The caesar salad was perfectly made.. made to order and everything from scratch! The roast chicken was also incredible, full of flavor, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, with the bread salad underneath. The french fries were also incredible.. they just do everything right in this kitcken!
author: Tyna P.

description:
My first meal at Zuni was over 15 years ago, and I loved it; I just had brunch here and I'm so pleased to report that it hasn't lost any of its fine quality.  I love everything about Zuni.  The ambience/ambiance -architecture, decor, corner location, huge windows, copper accents, the constant bustle- makes me feel like I'm in a cafe in Paris.  The staff are impeccably dressed and trained, yet there is not 1 hint of pretension; only expert and friendly service.  And the food is always delicious.  Sadly, I only have dined here a few times over the past 15 years, but every meal has been memorable because every item is delicious, including the bread.  A few have griped that the menu doesn't "experiment" enough, but when I dine out, I expect top quality in the ingredients and flavor, and Zuni consistently delivers.  This is one of the few places where I eat slower instinctively (which is very hard for me), because I want to savor every mouthful.  The prices are no more expensive than at any of the other high-quality restaurants in SF.  Many of the other restaurants in SF (especially some of the newer ones), are highly overrated: I have left several of them disappointed because although the dishes may have been very new or creative, the flavors didn't match up.  Although I have only dined at Zuni a few times, I have tried completely different appetizers and entrees at every visit, and always left happy.  And, yes, the roasted chicken is worth the wait.
   So many long-time quality SF institutions have gone out of business over the past decade; I truly hope Zuni never shuts its doors.
author: JJ M.

description:
Went with friends after getting married at city hall. We mentioned we had just gotten married, and were a bit disappointed they didn't waive a single corkage for a bottle of nice champagne, on a $400 bill. I didn't ding them for that, honestly, since it's not something they have to do; just would have been a nice comp.

Food was great, though everything is definitely on the costly side in terms of value for money, especially the dessert menu. Service was on-point.
author: Greg R.

description:
After finished watching Phantom of the Opera, we walked over to Zuni cafe , hoping for a nice dinner to wrap up the evening.  We arrived earlier than our reservation time, the host told us he could not seat us as they must honor the other "reservations".  Hmmm, it was 5 PM, the restaurant was half empty..  While we were waiting by the bar area, a waitress came by and asked us if we wanted to order any drinks.  We told her some water would be be nice for now, without saying a word, she just turned around and walked away, the water never came, we were totally invisible to her during the 45 minutes wait in this half empty restaurant.  

We ordered

chicken for two -  Tasty but nothing spectacular
Salmon - weird and bitter taste, portion is tiny
Pork Loin - tiny portion and nothing to brag about.

We asked our waiter for new plates so we could share our food, guess what? No plates were brought to us. Very inattentive service, there are much better restaurants to spend $200.00 for an evening meal.
author: Raymond N.

description: There is no point in arguing whether the famed chicken and bread salad is good.  It is.  The question is whether it's $50 kind of good or whether it's one hour wait kind of good.  On that note, I have some reservations. The chicken was very tender and perfectly seasoned indeed, but the bread and salad were drenched in too much dressing.  The appetizers were decent enough, and the service was very much on point.
author: Angel S.

description:
My guest and I ordered the roast chicken which has been widely reviewed and raved about. The menu description gives a false impression that the meal was balanced. 

There were no vegetables. 

The waiting time for the main course took a full hour, and the waiter did not instruct us that we would wait that full hour for the chicken to be cooked (although it is mentioned on the online menu). 

We ate a house salad meanwhile. It consisted of romaine lettuce and some cheese sprinkles. No tomatoes. 

The warm bread was just four slices, and the waiter never brought us a bread plate, so bread crumbs scattered across the table and over the menus which the waiters did not remove until our salads were served. 

My guest ate practically all of the bread, he was so hungry waiting for his main course. The chicken, when it finally arrived, was glazed and looked like it was photographed for a gourmet magazine beforehand, but the taste was nothing special. 

The chicken was merely warm and a little too soft. My guest and I each ordered a bitter beer and we had some chocolate cake dessert, which was palatable but nothing to rave about.

For $121 (including tip), this meal was strikingly ordinary, even below average considering that this is a "fine dining" establishment.  Going here was not something I'd care to repeat.
author: Charles S.

description:
Woof. What an amazing experience here at Zuni Cafe. Sure, the roasted chicken gets a lot of attention, but folks, the burger is the real deal. That's really all you need to know, but if you want to know why? Read on.

Star 1: How was the service and atmosphere?

Excellent. While the 1600 block of Market Street wouldn't be considered by hardly anyone as 'upscale', you forget about all that the moment you walk in the door at Zuni. Hostesses and Servers dressed to the nines compliments a unique multi-room seating arrangement that's brought together by a kitchen that's wide open. It's great. Star Granted.

Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?

My only gripe here is the cost. Yes, at Zuni you pay for the atmosphere and an excellent product, but at the end of the day that premium can only go so far. For a quality, freshly made burger? I put that cap right at $15.00, and thanks to an unusual 4% surcharge that's on top of menu prices, my burger was $16.25:

http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=QCh42m4-FK7-ewhwxhyI8A&userid=OKX-V5j_qfuOebeHeWGrHg

If it came with fries? Fine, but it didn't, and I can't quite justify that price for just a burger. No Star Granted.

Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?

Marvelous on all fronts. Let's start with the bun shall we? WOW. I'll say it, off the top of my head, this was the best burger bun I've had. ever. Fresh bread with a tinge of salt and garlic butter, I could have eaten it sans burger and called it a meal. I didn't, and that's because the burger patty was tip top notch. Freshly ground, cooked to perfection and full of flavor, this patty proved that Zuni knows that a good burger is only as good as it's patty. The topping were almost forgotten purely due to the majesty of the burger/patty combo, but the onions and pickles proved a nice touch. Well done Zuni, well done indeed. Dual Stars Granted.

Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?

Between chicken of citywide fame and a burger that had me reeling, Zuni Cafe blew me away, and I could easily eat there daily if I could afford it. Star Granted.
author: Paul V.

description:
One word: Delicious.

Zuni Cafe is a super cool spot for drinks and dinner. Reservations are not easy to come by but if you come early enough, you can get seated pretty quickly, for us, we were seated within 15 min but we got there at 6pm.  

Their wine list isn't extensive but they quality is great. I always drink red wine - I had the Sangiovese and the Pinot Noir. Both were very good.

I am a roasted chicken gal so I was super excited to try their famous chicken which did not disappoint. My only issue would be that it's a bit too pricy but it was delicious.

I also had the ricotta gnocchi which was by far the best gnocchi I've ever eaten. It was fluffy and the flavor was perfect...I LOVED it.  We also had their caesar salad which was another awesome dish.

Service was on queue. The service and all the food runners were amazing.  The I think this is a great place to grab dinner, but it can be pricy so be warned.
author: Mel D.

description:
Wow, this was really a fantastic burger!  Juicy and seasoned to perfection, I ordered this medium and it was great.  Something unique about the burger is they use a focaccia bread, which is rich and decadent and perfect to hold the richness from the meat.  The shoestring fries were also great and I left the meal very satisfied.

I was here for lunch on a nice day and it was great to sit outside and enjoy a nice meal outdoors.  Overall, the restaurant had an urban-chic décor that is welcoming and perfect for the kind of menu available.

The staff was friendly and attentive - I can't wait to go back.
author: Ken G.

description: Had the tomato soup and beet salad. The salad was great..it had pomegranate seeds and greens and chia seeds. The soup was a little more like a minestrone vase versus a bisque bit it was also good. For desert we had the thumbprint cookies and almond horchata which were excellent in terms of texture and flavor. All in all great food and good prices.
author: Alexandra J.

description: Lovely restaurant to visit when you're not exactly hungry yet but will be getting hungry very soon. Don't come already hungry because it will change your opinion of this place. I came knowing this and thus my experience was lovely. Yes, the chicken takes an hour to cook, but I suppose it takes that long to make it juicy and moist. I only normally eat chicken legs and wings because any of the white meat is pretty dry and flavorless. I ate so much white meat today, it was moist, juicy, tender, flavorful. And I was told it was organic. That doesn't matter much to me, but yeah its a plus. Oysters were good also, had both kumamotos, fanny bay and a shingu.. something from Washington. And bloody Mary's were the perfect kick. Servers were polite and prompt. Great dining experience, would definitely come back if I'm in the bay area.
author: Kim Tracy S.

description: Food is delicious, but not a fan of the bartender.. I ordered a glass of red wine ($15) and it was cold. I asked for a new one and he said all the red wine is chilled and they need to keep it at a certain temperature. (could be because they keep it by the window, not sure.) Rude!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Their chicken with salad was delicious! BUT my mom got sick for a week. So their status is high but it seems like their quality of food not that much
author: Layanne L.

description:
BF and I were on a Hayes Valley day...and this was not far from Civic Center BART.  

We had an eventful trip over...our station had a bomb scare, and we were advised to go to the next station after standing around for 15 minutes.  We did, and got a train out nearly an hour later than we had expected.  Somehow me made ti the the restaurant on time.

Greeted and seated quickly our server was quick to take our orders.   We both had a glass of the Grüner Veltliner (so glad to see this showing up on menus) split a salad, and pasta.

Our food took over an half an hour to arrive....but it was yummy!!  

Shortly after the salad course the large extremely obnoxious party arrived.  These folks were literally screaming at each other.

We finished quickly and paid. 

Waiting for the girls room, I went and mentioned to the hostess that the party was far too loud...and what she said next floored me...*it's a wedding party*  YES, and that excuses this deplorable behavior??  Seriously, this is not a Sport Bar!!!  I should have spoken to the manager, but I was so disgusted, I left.

Sorry Zuni Cafe....lunch sucked because you did not even attempt to control your guests.
author: Katherine F.

description:
Thursday night, no reservation, seated right away on one of the tables in the bar area (i.e. not the dining room).

We had high expectations because of reviews on yelp and blogs. They were not met.

We had burrata with grilled squash and same raddichio as an appetizer. Flavors were delicate and very nice. The portion, however, was tiny, especially for the price. Exactly the same is true for the rabbit and the squab that we had as main dishes. Lovely flavors, but incredibly small portion, barely two forks of meat and very few sides; way too little for a 36 USD price tag each. After that, we decided against a dessert.

The drinks (Manhatten-style drink, they call it Lido 2.0, and an Orange Blossom, a type of champagne cocktail) were delicious. The wines we had by the glass, however, were extremely disappointing. A Russion River Valley pinot noir which had absolutely no business even being on the menu, especially not for 15 USD a glass. A California Zinfandel which was ok, but not even close to being of the quality you'd expect (I wouldn't even pay those 12 USD for a bottle of that wine). We are no wine snobs, but this was close to being unacceptable.

In the end, we were glad we had a few servings of bread on the house. Otherwise, we would have left even hungrier than we did (after a roughly 180 USD check!!!).

Disappointing; would not go again. (Not even for the chicken. Saw it on the table next to us and the theme of small portions seemed to continue which is sad for a 58 USD chicken).
author: M. A.

description: Chicken, chicken, chicken...YUM ! Order it right when you sit down as it takes 60 minutes from "oven to table". Soup and bread were delish as well, but the service was a little slow and choppy. Had to pour my own wine which is no big deal, but I already do that at home for 70% less money. 5 STARS all go to the kitchen here !!
author: Lucy R.

description:
I have been here several times, for cocktails and oysters, a quick lunch, and of course, the chicken they are so famous for (and minimum one hour heads up required).

Consistently good food and very filling. The extra star is for the service. In my pre-lawyer days I was a bartender and a server and this place a) trains their staff impeccably b) selects them carefully or c) both (Jenna in particular comes to mind and has served me on more than one occasion). 

The chicken,  a "10/10".

The oyster selection is diverse (and appreciated), although maybe try and get Raspberry Points (I know I know, only one distributor I think).

If you want ambiance, service, and consistently good staple dishes (save the chicken, which defies reason), you won't be disappointed.
author: Mike V.

description: Really happy I ate here - first meal off the plane. Came for lunch and had a balsamic Bloody Mary, arugula salad in citrus vinaigrette (paprika almonds!) & chickpea ragout with lamb and fry bread. Everything was delicious and service was quite good, from the waiter, to the guy who brought me bread and the manager. I had a seat by the kitchen, which was fun to watch. When  I come back (with a second person), I will be ordering the chicken. Only thing I would change is the temperature of the butter for the bread - mine was way too cold to spread.
author: Teresa G.

description:
I've come here for dinner and really enjoyed it; recently my friend told me Zuni never has a wait for brunch so I was excited to try that out too. 

However, it ended up being an hour wait for 3 of us! The first in our group got there around noon and was told it would be 30 minutes. We got there around 12:15 or 12:20pm. Around 12:30pm, we were offered a TINY 2-top, which would definitely not have been enough room for 3 plates. That meant more waiting, and we didn't get sat until about 1pm. By the time we left, around 1:45 or 2pm, there were plenty of open tables.

Our server was very sparkling (his personality - and he had a very well-pruned look), professional, and enthusiastic. 

* Free bread - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zuni-caf%C3%A9-san-francisco-3?select=4UZMp8M96e5Y9RYBRQZ-uw#_JaBE2VMTer5NViNUIr2JQ
This was great! Surprisingly, this might have been the best dish in our meal. Maybe we were just so starving from our 1 hour wait. But the crust on this bread was very thick and crunchy, while the inside was soft and spongy without being soggy and a hint of sourdough-like flavor. Just right, and great for soaking up the Three-bean soup!

* Devil's Gulch Rabbit w/ mashed potatoes, broccoli romanesco, spicy cress, & breadcrumbs salsa ($17.50) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zuni-caf%C3%A9-san-francisco-3?select=4UZMp8M96e5Y9RYBRQZ-uw#aEg1i025_VTDSMcisMzrJQ
This was our server's huge recommendation. He could not have raved about this more! I thought it was good, recommendation-worthy, but not as amazing as he made it out to be. Every part of this dish was cooked perfectly, almost too perfect and pristine! The mashed potatoes - smooth texture, flavorful. The broccoli were great, slightly charred and this subtle bitter flavor. The rabbit had a nice light breading and was moist, but for rabbit meat I found it to be a little hard--I'm used to it being much more tender! Every piece just seemed very delicately placed on the plate so nothing touched anything else--it was just a bit sparse for one of the most expensive items on the menu. 

* Fettuccine w/ hedgehog mushrooms, leeks, goat butter, lemon zest, & black pepper ($16.50) - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zuni-caf%C3%A9-san-francisco-3?select=4UZMp8M96e5Y9RYBRQZ-uw#4UZMp8M96e5Y9RYBRQZ-uw
I tried a bite and this was tasty, the pasta a fresh soft (and yet al dente) texture, with a light bit of sauce. But like the Rabbit, this was very sparse and a really small plate! I'm amazed my boyfriend didn't have to order a second dish, he'd been so hungry beforehand.

Lunch menu: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/zuni-caf%C3%A9-san-francisco-3?select=4UZMp8M96e5Y9RYBRQZ-uw#KxPIlQj1-x5ufIZN7VsdFQ
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Great food , ambiance interesting , average waitstaff , fantastic bartenders! Great cocktails including la vie en rose ( champs but not too sweet) elderflower cocktail and the captain -- a whiskey cocktail the bartender gladly changed up for my friend who only drinks brandy.
Food was marvelous didn't have the chicken but looked great- the steak , pork chop Caesor salad, and egg dish were excellent. 
Desert of cranberry grappa sorbet and gateau Victoire were amazing ( not heavy).
Wait staff was adequate but not very attentive.  Would go again with reservations - walk in took 1 1/2 hours to seat .
author: Mary V.

description:
White tablecloth place where the servers wear ties. Cool upscale diner setup with a wall of glass facing the street... the Cafe part of the name is starting to make sense. 

We started with the fried squid and okra. For the main course I opted for the Halibut, and I went with strawberry sorbet for dessert. Nothing blew me away but it was all well-prepared. Portions were on the lighter side. Maybe I would have been more impressed if I went with the famous chicken, but I was hungry and didn't feel like waiting the recommended hour for them to prepare it. 

For the price range, I wasn't very impressed with the service. Our waiter was sporadic. It was 5-10 minutes after we were seated before anyone came over to get us started, and he would disappear for extended periods of time during important moments (ie... once we were ready to order and once we were ready to pay).
author: David B.

description:
Over 4 years in SF and finally tried out Zuni for brunch on Sunday. Over all: service okay, food great, price high for portion size. 

We didn't have a reservation, but I read online they keep the bar and outside tables for walk ins. Was pleasantly surprised to get a set upstairs near the window right away. 

My boyfriend and I like to share plates when we go so we can try a little of everything and not get too full in the process. We started with the Olive Oil cake. So good! The apple butter was my favorite part. 

This is where things kind of took a turn services wise. We had asked to share the sausage dish, but have the egg it's served with scrambled, not fried. What they brought was was the sausage dish AND a scrambled egg dish. When I brought this up to the waitress, she was so huffy and visibly irritated! "But we HAVE an egg dish on the menu." "Ok, but we didn't want that, we just wanted to share the sausage dish." The food runner took the food back to the kitchen and the waitress walks away, throwing her hands up and shaking her head. Like, I'm sorry you're frustrated, but don't let the customer see it! 

They brought back our order as we asked for it, and everything tasted really good! It was too bad getting it was such a fiasco.
author: Amber W.

description:
We were in the city impromptu for half a day and wanted to just grab a nice dinner before heading back to San Jose where we were in town for a tournament. 

We stumbled across this place and a quick read stated it was pretty good but didn't read any reviews or notes why it was popular.  It was just ok - I wish the waitress had suggested the chicken, which after reading was the signature dish.  The gnocchi was delish but the menu was a bit pretentious overall as well as the wait staff - don't try so hard you can tell.  The Squab was the most disgusting thing it was like a rubber toy.
author: Paulymeatballs T.

description:
Came here late after seeing a show and was pleasantly surprised that Zuni Cafe was still open.  We ordered 2 items:

1) Bowl of polenta with mascarpone (or Parmigiano-Reggiano)

It was just okay for me.  It was good but not exactly what I had expected.

2) Gnocchi 

Simply the best gnocchi that I've ever had.  It melts in your mouth, unlike your typical gnocchi that are rubbery and chewy.  Definitely worth a try but the only downside is the cost ($$$).
author: Mango T.

description:
Amazing food and service
Salads with flavour and pinache I especially like the pickled watermelon rind in the chicory salad. Of course the chicken is to die for but the beef was also phenomenal. The desert was also wonderful and my wife thought her Cesar salad was the best she ever had. In short, don't come here - I want the table.
author: C.m. H.

description:
This place is the BEST! 

Had a great birthday lunch with a couple of good friends today...

Jeff B. is an INCREDIBLE server. His recommendations and attention to detail were SPOT on:)
author: Rob S.

description: Arrive early and get the entire chicken. Be sure to order fries with it to be served with it. Get outlandishly drunk during the hour plus this chicken takes. It's fine the chicken is worth it. I know it's a long time, but cope with the knowledge that the chicken is worth it. They should show professional wrestling because of the wait. Get the chicken.
author: Eric J.

description:
Nice restaurant located way uptown on Market St.  Zuni has been here forever and is an institution in SF.  

Entrance actually on Rose St. behind the restaurant.  Valet parking available, but we got lucky and found a space on Market close to Zuni behind someone who parked in front of a hydrant all night - possibly an Uber driver waiting for riders leaving Zuni?  

Although Zuni is a nice place, everyone was pretty casually dressed.  The woman next to us was wearing jeans and sneakers.  Very noisy place and the tables are pretty close to each other.  

We shared the roast chicken dinner which was excellent.  Maybe a bit pricey for roast chicken, but it was one of the least expensive items on the menu.  Started with a dozen raw oysters, the Zuni caesar salad, and a mountain of shoestring fries..  Yum.  

Service was excellent.  Liked everything about Zuni, but would it kill you to dress up a bit?
author: Doctor G.

description: Finally made it to Zuni with two friends. Friends started with assorted oysters and Ommigon beers. I had house anchovies with cheese, olives & celery plus house white wine. That plus great bread and butter kept us going till their signature dish of roasted chicken over greens and stuffing came. That dish takes 60 minutes. Clearly they roast each order and deliver it immediately. All the food was delicious. Chicken was wonderfully moist. Our server was the nicest and most accommodating server I may ever have had. They have a well-earned reputation.
author: Carol G.

description: Took my husband for his birthday. The tuna was delicious. Our waitress Almia think that is spelled correctly, she was a hoot. Had us laughing. I'll be back for sure.
author: Rey B.

description: Atmosphere was fabulous, food was ok but our waitress was very unpleasant. I've never felt like such a bother to someone before. Jorgi may need a break, she didn't seem very happy to be there today...disappointing.
author: Rosemarie M.

description:
The place is great!! Very good entertainment! The food is delicious! A little bit pricey,but it's definitely worth it!
We ordered  Polenta, Caesar salad, and gnocchi for starting, and Salmon for main course. 
See some Photos!!:)
author: Regina L.

description:
I heard wonderful things about Zuni so I had high expectations, but I wasn't impressed with the food.

- Service: Fantastic.  Our waiter was very nice and attentive.

- Drinks: I had the Fresh Lime Margarita, and my friend had the Elderflower Cocktail.  Both were delicious and refreshing, but I'd recommend the Elderflower since it's something different.

-  Food:  Manila Clams, Shoestring Potatoes, Ricotta Gnocchi, and the famous Roasted Chicken.  The clams were juicy and flavorful, and the gnocchi melted in my mouth (although you might not like this if you don't like cheese).  The potatoes were essentially thin potato fries, which wasn't anything special.  The most disappointing dish was the chicken -- it wasn't juicy, texture wasn't tender (in fact, it was quite rough), and the flavor didn't wow me in any way.  The breading was good with the chicken, but I still left feeling confused as to why Zuni is famous for this chicken.

- Dessert:  Flourless chocolate cake and strawberry shortcake.  The chocolate cake had a great thick, smooth texture, and the shortcake served as a light dessert.  Yet just like the chicken, the dessert didn't blow me away.

I loved the service and ambiance, so I'd probably come back again but order different entrees.
author: Christine A.

description:
My review isn't a good one, but it is an honest one based on my one and only experience. That being said, I wouldn't want Zuni to go away. I know it is a longtime establishment that recently lost it's head chef who was renowned to be a true food legend. Zuni blesses an otherwise blighted part of Market Street and the customers there all seemed happy, familial. They even have live piano music as you dine.

I'll even go as far as saying that I feel like a failure to haute cuisine society for not enjoying Zuni's food. I want to apologize to someone, but I also couldn't shut the word "overrated" out of my head, especially since we paid nearly $100 for something so underwhelming. 

On paper, the menu was delightful. The options all seemed incredible. But I didn't get the memo that, unless you order the chicken, you're basically doing it all wrong. I ordered a blood orange and arugula salad and the pasta dish with a fava bean pesto. The pasta was tooth-chippingly al dente. Cutting through one of the little shapes showed that it was still party uncooked. They were gracious about swapping it out for a bowl of tasty polenta, no hesitation, but I was told that the pasta is "just thick" which is why it felt like chewing cud when I tried to eat it. And polenta and salad for dinner kind of sucks, no matter how you slice it.

I've said enough, but if you, too, didn't get what the hype was about, I'm just validating that this wasn't a place I'd get excited about returning to.
author: Lara W.

description:
Fabulous place to come and have lunch.  I love how there are floor to ceiling windows. The iron shape of the building allows so much natural light in - it makes you feel immediately lighter. 

We came here for a team birthday and split everything - family style. We ordered the two pizzas (broccoli & margherita), squid salad, ceasar salad, lamb pappardelle, and the sausage. Everything was done to perfection. My favorite were the squid salad and margherita pizza. The squid salad was just such a unique dish. The squid was perfectly cooked and sliced into perfect little circles, the peppers added just enough crunch and slight heat. The dressing was light and tangy. The  margherita pizza consisted of a thin, crunchy crust topped with freshly grated cheese not melted cheese.  I've never had pizza like this and it was fantastic! The cheese was grated so thinly that every strand just melted instantly in my mouth. 

Drinks were  necessary for a birthday celebration.  Everyone agreed that they were quite heavy handed with the cocktails but that wasn't a complaint ;) I think I was in a pink mood because I ordered the pink gin & tonic and a glass of rose to follow. 

We had to finished off the meal with dessert.  I went with the lemon sorbet.  It was super puckery. A tad too sour to finish all on my own.  I preferred my coworker's fig ice cream to my dessert. But it was all very tasty.

Next time, I would want to come back and try the infamous chicken as well as some oysters since they have a fresh oyster bar downstairs.
author: Jojo L.

description: This place is polished and sleek. What a fun night we had with our large ragtag group, arriving in waves. We weren't the simplest table to negotiate, and the space is limited (you may even get in someone's way) but their staff make it work. We began with a mixologist who stirred up the most perfect cocktails. I had an Orange Blossom. The lights installed for the holidays add extra ambiance and warmth. It is a hip place and the food is delicious. Try the fries if you haven't already downed the entire bowl by yourself and ordered another one, like me. I couldn't help it.
author: Helen K.

description:
This will be my second time dining at Zuni and once again I am impressed by both the ambience and cuisine.
Ambience:  Tonight a live piano player's music drifted through the casually elegant open space of Zuni's dining room and bar area.  Lighting was absolutely perfect (not too bright not too dark) and even with a full busy bar I could easily hear my date across the table. 
Cuisine: Having had the renowned chicken my first time round at Zuni (note this dish takes an hour to arrive and can easily feed 3 but is well worth the wait) I was compelled to test the other dishes.  I can say, without exaggeration, I had the best gnocchi of my life.  Melt in your mouth with a little crunch of fried caper heaven. Do not miss this dish.  Second "the best of my life no exaggeration" winner of the night was the green tea. So compelling that I even asked the brand so I could purchase some myself...
I could go on about the oysters, halibut and Arugula salad, oh my! But my recommendation is to  just stop reading and go, you will not be disappointed!
author: Justina L.

description:
A very nice restaurant, with one of SF's truly greatest dishes.  Visitors know SF for crab, clam chowder sourdough bread bowls, garlic fries at the ballpark, etc, but locals know the 1hr roasted chicken for 2 is truly an amazing 'legendary' dish within SF.  Everything else I have had on Zuni's menu is 3-4 star level food, and they are usually small dishes or salads, apps, etc intended to fend off starvation while waiting for the chicken.

So- the chicken- is ALWAYS 5 stars+.  I appreciate it very much as this dish hasn't eroded or slacked off for the past 5-6 years since I first tried it.  Juicy chicken, soft and buttery warm baked bread chunks, pine nuts, currants, and mustard greens as a garnish.  I wouldn't go to Zuni without ordering this, and when I book reservations at Zuni its solely with this dish in mind.  The other items we ordered on our most recent visit were all good to great- a GIANT caesar salad, a creamy polenta, and a gnocchi dish.  However we were foolish to order this much as it detracted from our available capacity for the chicken dish.  However the chicken revives extremely well with a short bake in the oven the next day :-)

All in all, I'll be back, and it will be for the chicken- and I will dominate it.
author: Andy S.

description: I'm giving stars for the reasonably good chicken/ cocktails, great ambiance (nice natural lighting, not too loud), and pleasant service. Getting the roast chicken special is one of those things to experience when you live in the Bay Area. However, although the chicken was good, it was not $60 for two people good. The chicken had a smoky flavor and was well but not oversalted. However it was a bit dry and the flavor wasn't over the top. So a somewhat OK splurge but if you don't care about atmosphere or service, there are better chicken meals to be had in the Bay Area for under $15/ person.
author: L C.

description:
I really really enjoyed my meal at Zuni Cafe... The building is beautifully cool, the room has an electric buzz of happy patrons dining and drinking away, the menu is short and concise, but still interesting, the libations are esoteric and quite tantalizing... The reason for 4 stars is that for this delicious slightly elevated comfort food you pay way too high of a premium. I mean chicken for $58? I scoff.
We started with the Nebbiolo and a Pinot and had the house cured anchovies. They were delicious with olive oil, lots of lemon, yummy slices of cheese, celery and itsy bitsy olives. They went great with the housebaked bread they bring you. Next we moved on to the incredible Caesar salad. I am telling u, it is a creamy garlicky standout not to be missed!! We then moved on to the salmon dinner which was pretty average, the polenta with parmigiana and marscapone which was in desperate need of the salmon and it's seasonings, the linguine and clams... A bit salty but good, and the gnocchi which came as a very tiny portion for $18.75.
The desserts were sublime... We had the gateau victoire and the pluot cobbler... And a glass of pineau des Charentes. 
The meal was very enjoyable, but the bill at $216 or so was way too high for the portion sizes, etc. If Zuni Cafe were just a tad more affordable it would leave a much better taste in my mouth... Pun intended.
author: Nancy B.

description: I came back to Zuni's and their Chicken for two never disappoints. It is best to start off with oysters, and if your not a fan of shellfish then hit up the Caesar Salad. Their lamb chops is good, but they should offer more lamb on the app. Great bread and butter, reminds me of European bread style. One of our sides the mixed veggies was very salty, so the server brought us a new one. Desserts are great, especially the fruit crisp with vanilla ice cream. Sharing most of the items and Zuni's is good to do, and the staff is very attentive. They also have valet parking for your convenience as well. Overall, I will be back for that chicken.
author: Mark L.

description:
Really bad this time around. The salmon was a thin strip and had black-eyed peas and a few other vegetables. For 37 bucks I expected to be full. How wrong I was. The portions are tiny, so be prepared to order more than an entree and 2 appetizers per person. I am not a huge eater, but the portions were tiny. The chicken dish what they are known for looks like the only dish that is large. We all left hungry and didn't order more due to time constraints. Another big negative is that we had 3 different waiters. I believe the waitress blew us off because we were not ordering drinks which would have ensured a larger tip. I am not sure though. Perhaps the worst part about the meal is that the food was warm. The lamb my partner ordered must have been sitting before it was brought to the table.
I felt as though I were eating at a different restaurant. A real disappointment. Because the first experience was so good, I would maybe try again. However with all the other choices in SF, probably not. This restaurant seems to have hit its shelf life.
author: S. G.

description:
It's my understanding that this place has been around for a long time.  It's in a dicey part of town, and parking can be found, but it isn't easy.  We parked at a garage that cost of 12 dollars for a couple of hours.  Walked over several homeless people on the way to the restaurant.  Just FYI - no parking is easy here.

The place is vintage, older building, good ambiance.  I wish we could have enjoyed it more, but it was SOOOO HOT, and the place was not prepared for the warm outdoor temperatures.  No A/C at all, as it is an old building.  I found most of the items on the menu to be 'hot' food, not much other cooler foods than salad.  This place has a ton of fresh seafood too, and if I hadn't been preparing to take a airplane out in a couple of hours, I might have indulged in some.

They had interesting french fries, worth getting.  Huge portion size.  The burger that they prepared was good as well.  In fact, the food was great.  

The staff person got upset with my companion about her sitting out of the sun, and blocking the entry.  It's okay, I'm sure on a better day I would go back, but I would pass on this one next time.  It's not the restaurants fault, it's everything else (parking, homeless, bad neighborhood).

I would check it out if you want good food, you will get it here.
author: Heidi F.

description:
This is a great place to go in the city. First, it has valet parking and additional parking on side streets. Second, it is beautiful for the tall windows allow you to see in an out of the building almost 360 degrees. Third, and most importantly, the drinks and food are incredible. The oyster selection is great and the food, cooked mostly in a wood-fire oven, is superb. Of course they have the amazing chicken, but almost every other item in the menu is made to perfection. 

I highly recommend this place for both locals and visitors; you will not walk away unhappy.
author: Del M.

description:
I came here with my parents the night of my pastry school graduation, figuring it would be a wonderful place to celebrate. The atmosphere around was festive, as it was Pride weekend, and I was ready for a delicious meal. To be short and sweet: the food was amazing, but the service was disappointing. That's the only reason I didn't give five stars - our waiter was at times rude and messed up a variety of things.

Let's get the bad out of the way. Our waiter (whose name I have but won't call out publicly):
-was short and curt with my stepdad about the wine list, when he was looking for a sweet (dessert-style) wine to start off the meal
-messed up the Caesar salad order, after my mom specifically asked for the dressing on the side. When it came tossed in dressing, he didn't apologize and made up same excuse saying she had decided NOT to have it on the side. What? That was bizarre. They did make a new salad which the maitre'd or host or someone else brought (also without an apology) to the table instead of the waiter
-also messed up the french fries, which my mom had requested to be without salt. No apology, no correction
-ALSO messed up my mom's trout order. She specifically asked if the "whole fish" came with the head on, and when the waiter said it did, she asked if it could be brought to the table without the head. The waiter said it could. Guess what...it didn't. Head on. 

I mean seriously...with this many errors, it seems like they were making the mistakes on purposes. Throughout the rest of the meal, any time the waiter came by, he wasn't very friendly or helpful. It was a shame, because it put a damper on our evening.

Now, for the food:
Caesar Salad - I ate the version with the dressing tossed on it and it was definitely one of the best I'd ever had.
Shoestring fries - amazing. Simply amazing.
Roast chicken - delicious, moist, juicy and flavorful. My stepdad was amazed and stunned at how a chicken could taste that good. And the bread salad underneath? My oh my was that amazing.
Trout - delicious. Simple preparation and intensely flavorful.

We skipped dessert, not want to risk another error, and made our way out. I'd love to give Zuni another chance, because the food is so good, but I'll be sure to make sure I'm seated in a different waiter's section!
author: David B.

description:
I have been wanting to try Zuni's famous roast chicken for over 2 years now and happened to visit twice in 1 week. It was featured on the 7x7 100 Things to Try Before You Die in SF, so I was quite surprised that it was so juicy, yet crisp on the outside. 

There were some highlights on the menu (spaghetti with squid tasted so fresh, and pizza), and low lights (the sea bass tasted like it was cooked from frozen), and things not worth getting (the shoestring fries are fine - exactly like you'd expect, the burger despite not liking blue cheese, is actually quite good but I wouldn't come back just for it). 

Make sure you get the chicken if you come for dinner, and keep in mind it really does take about an hour to come out.
author: Jess C.

description:
I know Zuni to be a favorite among many...and a constant "top ten" in SF write-ups....that's why I got a table last weekend to celebrate my sister's bday. 

The good: 
1. We were seated quickly and at a nice table.
2. We were offered beverages quickly (they were not served as quickly but that doesn't belong on this list).
3. Oysters were fresh and delicious (though I ordered four and was served three - also doesn't belong on this list).
4. Didn't feel rushed at any time - which was awesome given the wait outside for a table.
5. Our food server remembered to put a candle in dessert (cheese plate in our case) but didn't sing (not like every restaurant or server will, but it's nice).

The not-so-good:
1. Our food server was often missing in action...fine except when the entrees come before the beverages.
2. As I mentioned above, I ordered four oysters and received three. Didn't even think to check the bill until it was too late.
3. My sister ordered the pasta of the day and simply put, it wasn't very good. Nothing exciting about it and probably the wrong choice for a restaurant known for it's meat.
4. My steak was good but not great and there was more potato than steak on the plate.
5. The cheese plate was uneventful. Like, really uneventful.

When you drop a couple hundred dollars on a birthday dinner and walk away feeling only "okay" about it, it begs the question of whether or not to return. We were off to a concert at the Warfield that night and so it made sense for our needs. But alas, we may not return for a while.

Three stars because it was "okay" but not great.
author: Carrie S.

description:
Food is good. But the people who work there have questionable intelligence to me. 

If I order a pizza to the table and eat one slice and want the rest to go I can do it. 

If I order a pizza to go they tell me, "it's just not how we do things". 

Following rules without logic doesn't make sense. So if you do want stuff to go, order it, take a bite and then ask it to go.
author: mayank m.

description:
We heard of the brick oven roasted chicken from so many people and had to go try it... And it was HEAVEN! It is worth the 45min minimum wait!

Our server wasn't too friendly nor seem interested in his job, but the food saved it all. Make sure you have reservations though!
author: Ricardo H.

description:
It was already an Edith Piaf sort of day for the two of us at the start of this three day weekend, with us listening to many of her songs earlier in the day. When we hungered for early dinner, we randomly walked by Zuni, and decided it would be "the place." Only fitting that my first drink was titled "La Vie En Rose."

The upstairs seating is much larger than you might imagine. Once seated, we started with several varieties of oysters, the best of which were Kumamoto. We then had the House-cured Anchovies appetizer, which included some rather delicious olive oil. Next came the Ramps, Fiddlehead ferns, and Pixie tangerines. This whole veggie dish was surprisingly savory and citrusy.

At last, their signature dish, the Chicken for two cooked in the brick-oven stove arrived. We were told ahead this would require at least an hour from when it was ordered to come to the table, so it was justified, and the other dishes were served leading up to that. What made the chicken unique were all of the bread salad portions surrounding that were moist with chicken juices -- immensely flavorful! Surely the garlic and scallions kicked in, too, not to mention the crispy chicken skin.

It was a wine pairing night, too, with glasses of Rosé and Pinot Noir had as the evening progressed. Friendly, informative waiter helped guide our every move. Also fun to experience a real location filmed at within HBO's "Looking"! Great times all around.
author: Garett T.

description: Huge disappointment.  Have wanted to try their roast chicken for some time.  We were celebrating a friend's birthday and ordered the chicken.  The skin was not very crispy or brown, and the chicken tasted steamed/stewed.  Our waiter had major attitude.  Back in the day this may have been "the place" but now there are so many other interesting and good restaurants, so why bother.  Oh yes, I requested a nice table as this was a birthday celebration and we were given the worst table in the restaurant.  And, even though it was a birthday celebration, not even a little treat with a candle compliments of Zuni.  Would NOT recommend this place.
author: Pamela D.

description: Great experience! Chicken entree was delicious and the staff was very friendly. The wine list was not terribly marked up.
author: Danielle B.

description:
You know what makes me really happy? Honest, simple food. Pair that with a Friday night and Dad in town, it doesn't get much better!

Finally made it in to Zuni after a few years high on the "must-try" list. I'd heard about the famous chicken and bread salad one too many times, it was time to give it a go!

Yes, we ordered it, and yes, it was fantastic. Love when such simple ingredients and flavors are brought together to produce a dish truly out of its own league. I was surprised at how large the portion was. Menu states "for two", but our group of 3 had plenty of leftovers!

Also had the arugula salad, shoestring fries, and gnocchi. Salad was not memorable but the gnocchi was a treat - not at all weighed down or overly dense as I've come to expect.

Props to our waiter who was on his game the entire evening. Would happily return with an easy meal decision, next time I'll bring more mouths with me!
author: Brianna M.

description: I came to Zuni Cafe for my belated birthday celebration. This restaurant is really hard to get a reservation so make sure to make plan ahead. I was lucky enough to have my coworker help me get the table :) Their famous (1 hr. wait time) roasted chicken was no joke.
author: Jessica Y.

description: Over rated.  Over priced.  Food and service marginally acceptable.   Bathroom clean OK.  Nothing noteworthy about this place.   I have never seen this place more than half full, if you have a gift certificate better use it soon while it is still around.  There are many other places in San Francisco and this area, same price range, same style that are much better.
author: Thomas M.

description: Everything about Zuni is magical. If I could make my home in a restaurant, Zuni would be it. The chicken and bread salad is as good as everyone says it is, and get a plate of shoestring potatoes because why the hell not.
author: Casey P.

description: Had heard of this place forever, finally tried it with a group of friends for a birthday dinner.  It did not disappoint.  We got a corner upstairs to ourselves, which was great.  Service was attentive but not overbearing.  We got the mushroom pate appetizer (so good), one of the green salads (I honestly don't remember it, so probably fine but not amazing), fries (awesome) and the chicken.  Totally worth it - delicious and even my husband, a mostly non-chicken eater, was eating that crispy skin!  It's a lot of food, we probably went overboard on the apps and ended up with a fair amount of chicken left over.  We also got the flourless chocolate cake, which was good.
author: Kristen R.

description:
I returned here after a lunch three years ago. I'd liked the place, so Sunday night three of us dropped by here for dinner. 
Fast seating w no reservation, polite service. 
Ar $35 an entree I was surprised.  The portions were meager.  The pork loin was 2, 2.5" chunks and a sausage that was rather greasy, 10 beans,1 sautéed leaf of kale and puddle of polenta. 
Now I'd been at BOULEVARD The night before and had incredibly large portions for the same prices.  And the complexity of the flavors blew ZUNI away. 
So at this point I feel Zuni is coasting and not worth another visit.
author: Harold S.

description:
My boyfriend and I arrived 10 minutes early to our reservation and chose to stand at the bar with some cocktails while we waited. We agreed their Bloody Mary was the best one we've had (and we are real Bloody Mary fanatics!) 

Everything we ordered - the handmade ricotta gnocchi, tempura'd vegetables, tuna bocadillos, spaghetti with fresh vegetables, oysters - was insanely fresh and skillfully prepared. The integrity of the individual ingredient shines through in Zuni dishes. They were also nice enough to split the gnocchi into two plates for us when we asked. Our waitress was very attentive the entire meal.

Pricey? Yes. Small portions? Oh yeah. But I feel this place is worth it for the occasional splurge. And they've got a dry pear cider that I'm crazy about.
author: Linda W.

description: One of my favorite places in the city to sit and have a glass of wine with a friend. It's cozy in the bar area with all the window seats and I love their Cesar Salad or Polenta. The staff is always very friendly.
author: Sherry B.

description: Got a late reservation and in contrary to the odd seating layout and hot dining area upstairs my salmon and kale slaw was divine. Next time I will eat my dinner at the bar.
author: Anelya S.

description:
Burrata: amazing, melt-in-your mouth high quality cheese with a great crunch from the breadcrumbs. Get this.

They have delicate oysters too. Ask for what they recommend. 

The chicken: of course get this. It's what they're famous for. One piece of advice; if you can't finish it don't force yourself to. Instead, take it to go and leave it in the refrigerator for a meal the next day. It'll give the chicken a little bit of time to soak in the oil and improve the flavor of it all :)
author: Simon Z.

description: Six of us went to Zuni today for a great lunch just before the theater. We have been going to Zuni since 1998 and it never disappoints. Today we ordered 2 orders of their shoestring french fries - incredible, crunchy, addictive. Then we ordered 2 brick oven chicken - folks, it is perfection. The flavors are incredible and the bread salad that goes with it is divine. Each of us ordered the Domaine Chandon (not the one in Napa, the one in France) French Burgundy - perfection with the chicken. Over the moon - highly recommended.
author: C. C.

description: Yummi-Delish. We came in because of the Yelp reviews....the recommended roasted chicken, we were told, would take an hour to be served. We debated and decided to follow our fellow yelpers' reviews and ordered the chicken. We ordered a bottle of wine and started with the Cesar salad. OMG...so worth the wait. We're on a vaca so no rush for time and an afternoon buzz is almost mandatory...we throughly enjoyed our meal.
author: Brooke D.

description:
I'm happy to report that I can cook a better chicken dish at home!

Their signature dish was unseasoned (at least for my palate) with nothing other than salt and pepper?
I would have used rosemary and maybe placed some thinly sliced lemon wheels under the skin.
The accompanying bread salad was quite uneven in texture--either completely hard and scorched or soggy from the vinegar.
And, they are serious about it taking at least an hour to prepare this whole chicken.

The Drake's Bay oysters we started with were just ok, too.  How can you make fresh oysters taste better?  It's the mignonette sauce, of course.  Their version of this condiment wasn't as tasty as other restaurants in SF.  Scalas and Bix both have better versions.

The root vegetable soup was the best choice of the evening.  But, the thinly sliced small piece of black truffle that was floated on top had no taste whatsoever and provided an unexpected strange texture when trying to chew and swallow it.

The flourless chocolate cake for dessert was so-so.  Dry and uninspired.  The zeppoles with candied orange rind were a big miss too.

I'm glad to have tried Zuni but I've had better here in the city.  $221.51--2 people!
Parking is difficult.
author: Thomas D.

description:
I like simple reviews. Here goes.

Best roast chicken I have ever had. Tasty and moist. A must try.
Shoe string potatoes super good.
I don't eat raw oysters but they have the best selection I have every seen.
Service, couldn't be better.
author: Robert L.

description:
zuni's fries give alexander's a run for its money. so delicious. that's all. 

[i hear the chicken doesnt suck] [also perfect service]
author: Christina L.

description:
Everytime I come to Zuni Cafe I'm amazed at the combination of good food with really great service.

Made lunch reservations for 9 people but had to fill out a form to fax back with credit card number - not a big deal as many fancy restaurants do this. 

When we arrived our table was ready and they got out a high chair for us. They were super accommodating with our disorganized ordering and having a baby and splitting specific dishes to share, etc, etc. The general rambunctiousness that occurs when there's a family gathering with children involved. They weren't snotty or impatient at all. And we got lots of bread refills too. Generally just really patient and welcoming service.

Food as always was excellent. Hubby and I shared the burger (medium), shoe string fries and a caesar salad. I love a good classic caesar and it doesn't disappoint here. Crisp whole leaves of romaine really coated with dressing and cheese. They split the burger for us and it looked a little pink so I was a little concerned but it must have cooked a bit longer inside because it was just barely pink - perfect medium. The side of shoestring fries was a big plate - not just a small cone - enough to share with the table.
author: Jean K.

description:
Kind of a pompous vibe when you show up but the food isn't pompous - fried chicken Caesar salad and French fries . They know what's up minus well the bread pudding it could use some
Work
author: Laura G.

description:
Phenomenal spot and definitely a place I'd love to come back to again and again. 

You can't go wrong with anything here, although I have to say, now that I've had the famous chicken once, I don't need to have it again. It was delicious, but it was still just chicken. 

Also, definitely do dessert. Their chocolate cake is ah-mazing and the toasted almond ice cream with candied nuts on top was incredible. Don't miss it.
author: Megan B.

description:
This place was really great.  My friend and I had lunch here before seeing Phantom of the Opera at the Orpheum (walking distance, only about 1/2 of a mile).  We had a really fun time!  The ambiance is great and it's very trendy.  The food was good, not "knock your socks off" great, but pretty good.  I was dining with a vegetarian, and we were sharing so the choices were a little more limited.  When I come back, I'll probably try the burger or the chicken for two. :-)

We shared 3 items; the endive salad with figs: small portion, would have been great with some goat cheese or something, but it was good.  The polenta with mascarpone, it was pretty good.  And the basic cheese pizza, super thin crust, very light, but tasty.  The best part of this dining experience was the ambiance and the delicious cocktails!!!  The Elderflower was good, but the lemon drop type drink (can't remember the exact name, but you can figure out which one has vodka and lemon) was delicious!!!

I only give a full 5 stars if a place is perfection in all areas.  But 4 stars is a great rating too.  However to explain the 4 star rating:  I really loved the bus boy, Jordan.  He served bread and water and cleared plates and replaced silverware, etc.  He was FAR more pleasant and personable than our waitress, Katie.  She was barely adequate.  She never went out of her way to talk or be pleasant or suggest items on the menu or ask "how are you ladies doing today?" or ANYTHING.  And I expect great service at a restaurant, especially THIS kind of restaurant.  (Sorry Katie, but that is the truth).  Bummer, because I wanted to give the restaurant 5 stars, but if the service isn't amazing, it's not 4 stars.

I would STILL definitely recommend this restaurant; I'll definitely come back before a show at Orpheum.
author: Angel W.

description: This is a large venue that is able to accommodate parties of all sizes though I would highly recommend getting a reservation beforehand. There is a wide variety of wine and cocktails to accompany your meal.  The service was excellent. We had the pork chop which was cooked perfectly. The broccoli soup that was cheesy and delicious. The best of all was the gnocchi. This blew me away... I only wish there was more!!
author: Charlotte A.

description:
I was in SF on business and went for dinner on a recommendation from a friend. 
I had the Steelhead. It was amazing. Waiter recommended a local beer, Red Seal, I believe. It was also excellent. 
For dessert I recommend the panna cotta. 
It's definitely on my list to go back.
author: Kelley B.

description:
What can be said about Zuni that hasn't been said already? It's about as definitive a San Francisco dining experience as you can possibly have, and it continues to thrive no matter what new eatery hogs the spotlight. I hadn't been in many a moon until last week when I was having a hankering for something nice after the Yelp Elite soiree down on Valencia.
